citation.article-title: Fulvibacter tottoriensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from marine sediment.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Fulvibacter (Ful.vi.bac′ter. L. adj. fulvus yellowish brown; N.L. masc. n. bacter a rod; N.L. masc. n. Fulvibacter a rod that produces yellowish brown pigment).
Carotenoid-type pigments (absorption maxima at 425, 452 and 478 nm) are produced but flexirubin-type pigments are not produced (negative KOH test).
Sodium and magnesium ions are essential for growth but calcium ions are not.
The major cellular fatty acids of cells grown on TSA are iso-C15 : 1, iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0 3-OH.
MK-6 is the major respiratory quinone.
The type species is Fulvibacter tottoriensis.
